[EDIT] Solved - I downgraded node to v14.18.2 and I could install and run the app.

Hey all, I'm trying to build a new react app that's going to be hosted as a module on a page.

Steps I take:
• I use `hs create react-app`  to fetch a boilerplate from the github
• I do the hs init with `hs init`  and enter the portal code
• I try to install packages with `npm install`  but then I get an error regarding node-sass and the installation fails. Error starts with the following message
```ERR! code 1
npm ERR! path /Users/user/Desktop/hubex/react-app/node_modules/node-sass
npm ERR! command failed
npm ERR! command sh -c node scripts/build.js```
This worked last time I was creating one but for some reason it doesn't work now. Anyone had a similar issue?
I believe it's a dependency issue and I tried changing versions of node-sass and sass-loader but I couldn't make it work
Try removing node-sass from package.json and do the npm install if it works then, you have to find some other solution for sass instead of node sass I think
